p: From the present study, the insecticidal toxicities of T. ammi essential oil seem to be mainly attributed to the presence of thymol. Owing to the fact that T. ammi can be easily cultivated, has high essential oil yield, and the other two major compounds (Î³-terpinene and p-cymene) can be chemically converted into thymol via aromatization and hydroxylation reactions, respectively, this would make T. ammi essential oil a suitable candidate for the commercial development of a plant-derived insecticide.
